title: 10 bans: A serious issue that MUST be talked about.
body:
10 bans is great, it should happen.

BUT...

Riot wants it like this: you enter champ select and each team get's to simultaneously ban champs

THIS IS NOT GOOD

why? because theres NO strategy behind it, it's just ban who you hate/annoys you.

WAIT, THEN HOW SHOULD 10 BANS BE HANDLED?

Let's look at LCS/MSI:

You start with 3 bans, then pick champs, then you can ban 2, then you pick again, THIS PROMOTES STRATEGY AND UNIQUE INTERACTION WITH BANS.

But 10 simultaneous bans? c'mon

replies.body: The theory as to why it's not like is cuase champ select would take longer.

The "it would take too long" arguement is just an excuse. Even they know that getting into a match takes long because of the many dodges and the primary reason behind dodges is autofill (another badly executed idea...) and not that people can't wait through a 2 minutes banning phase. With a 1 minute shorter banning phase you will wait 13 minutes instead of 14 now - such a great improvement, isn't it? :)

The real reason - what even they told us, wrapped in excuses - that they don't want 10 bans actually. They don't want some of their hated/broken poster champs to be permabanned as they don't want to rework or balance them at all (think about the sea of Yasuo, Lee Sin, etc. one trick ponies who are all paying costumers, and this is a business and not a sport after all...).
The other reason - what makes a bit more sense - is that the last bans, especially the 2nd phase in the LCS format, would be aimed at certain roles, what means that you should have a reasonable champ pool to deal with 2-3 bans aimed directly at you. Again: one tricks would cry too much. But hey, in a ranked draft mode you shoud have a reasonable champ pool anyways. But if we could trade pick order - and not just already picked champs - it would help a lot (like I prefer to be the last pick, even in an LCS-like format...). And/or they should get rid of autofill except in top elo as they said it is only neccessary there, not in lower elos. (As a supp main I' autofill-protected, so don't think I'm whinning on personal issues about that...)
And I think there's one more reason, though they didn't say it afaik. There is a business strategy by Riot, "artifical meta rotation". That means they continuously keep on buffing, nerfing, reworking champs and items, making them suddenly broken then the next month perfectly out of the game. By this, the actually viable 20-30 champs always change so you always have to buy new champs and hopefully new skins for them, etc. Business. A proper 10 ban system would require them to finally sort out a proper balance, or even worse, the community would just ban the hell out of the FoTM champs, balancing the game by themselves against Riot's business strategy.

Don't get me wrong, I'm 100% with you that we should get the LCS system as it is (as even Riot said million times before about balance and autofill and such that one of their primary policies is that LoL has to be the very same from b5 to pro play...). But the real reason behind not getting it is obviously not much to do with the wait time, as the lenght of the banning phase isn't in the top 5 reasons for the long waiting for a match...

I couldn't agree more. It is such a shame that the people will never get the experience they deserve. It would actually work better because from what I am witnessing in the bans selection, people are just banning champs THEY do not like. No talk, no strategy, nothing. I mean, to be honest, how much stargazing can you do in 30 seconds with the flood gates open. The engineers at Riot I am sure always scratch there heads when they do major updates like this, when they say they are listening to the forums, but then turn it into some half ass project. Why make is over complicated? Why not just make simple like the model they use for LCS? If this is how they want it then I want to see it in the pros too. I want to know what the pro teams would have to say to something as inane and asinine as something as this.
Indeed and they could keep the 'prefer not to ban' option, and just have it default to that when their timer runs out, instead of booting everyone and researching for the match again.

Resulting in lost bans due to afks and trolls what will result in a long 20-30 minutes wasted on an unfair and probably terrible match...
No, thank you. If people don't have the time, mood, champ pool, etc. to play ranked draft gamemode then they shouldn't play it, that simple. Play blind pick or normals.
Decreasing the quality of ranked matches in the favour of trolls and one-tricks even encouraging them is a very very bad direction imho.
Thanks to poor and biased balancing riot has been forcing for years.
and the lack of communication that soloq has.

There's definitely a strategy idlk if you just didn't think about it but it's really interesting.  

Are you gonna waste your ban on {{champion:157}} because the other team will ban him...or will you ban it anyways because fuck {{champion:157}} you aren't taking any chances. Banning at the same time makes it a mind game.

The pro play format is cool but it's just not viable for solo queue in my opinion. There'd just be so much going on. Sure it's possible, i would actually really enjoy it. I just know the complexity of the strategy would be lost on most low level players.

The MSI format is just for that....pro play. Coordinated bans on specific positions. They also have the advantage of KNOWING who they're playing againt. You know the champion pool of the enemy so you can fully utilize the second ban phase. In solo queue, people just ban what they don't wanna play against.

That's just my take on it. I'd like to see the pro ban system in solo queue but i am still a huge fan of the ban system they're giving us.
You'll never get Solo Q to ban differently. They don't care about strategy; they care about having fun. So they ban the most overpowered champs and the most annoying champs.

I far as I have seen there will still be champion intent stage, that's the ideal time to talk about bans. Folks who care about strategy will ban off the threats to team comp and communicate. Folks who religiously ban champion from hate or to follow meta bans will do so, no change there, but you benefit from a net gain of 2 bans. Way I see things as long as its not one of your teams champs enemy bans can and should be ignored, and even if you lose some champs you should ideally (not be a foolish one tricker) have back up options.  If folks are smart they will use champ intent wiser then we do now.

This is the ONLY way to do it. We can't spend 10 minutes every game banning champions (that's a lil hyperbole, sure, but you get my drift). They have to maintain a fun and engaging pace, spending anymore time banning would be a huge turn off.

And there is strategy, just ban the champ that most counters the one you plan on playing. Same as before really just with less time being wasted.

The simplest solution would be to have bans occur similarly to picking champions.    That is:

* Blue Team bans 1 
* Red Team bans 2 
* Blue Team bans 2 
* Red Team bans 2
* Blue Team bans 2 
* Red Team bans 1

If they had players on the same team ban simultaneously, the duration would be the exact same as the previous banning system.
